intro: Symplocarpus, commonly known as water pepper, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Saururaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and often have small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers are usually greenish or white and are clustered in umbels, which are characteristic of the family. Symplocarpus species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. They are known for their ability to thrive in wet conditions, making them an important component of riparian and swamp ecosystems.
